title: Figma brings Photoshop-style precision edits into the canvas with three new AI tools

paragraphs.content: Figma has rolled out three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—aimed at making precise visual tweaks possible without ever leaving the design file.The features, announced on December 10, 2025, sit inside a new contextual toolbar in Figma Design and Figma Draw that also houses existing options like Remove background, Crop, and AI image generation.Figma says the update is intended to “close the loop” on time-consuming workflows that previously required exporting assets to external editors before bringing them back into the canvas.TechCrunch notes the move finally brings Figma in line with rivals like Adobe and Canva, which have offered object removal and image extension for years.

paragraphs.content: In practice, the new tools let designers lasso and erase unwanted elements, isolate and reposition objects while preserving realistic shadows and lighting, and extend images to new aspect ratios without distorting key content.Early coverage highlights use cases such as cleaning up product photography, adapting hero images for multiple device sizes, and preparing marketing visuals directly inside Figma.Figma positions these utilities as pragmatic AI—focused on everyday edits rather than purely generative effects—so teams can spend less time “finessing details” across formats.Hands-on reviewers say the update significantly reduces the need to bounce between Figma, Photoshop, and Canva for what were previously routine but disruptive tasks.

sections.title: How Erase, Isolate, and Expand reshape everyday design workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma’s **Erase object** tool pairs an upgraded lasso selection with AI-powered inpainting to remove selected elements while keeping surrounding colors, lighting, and textures stable for more natural-looking results.**Isolate object** similarly relies on the improved lasso to lift subjects out of a scene, allowing designers to move or restyle them while maintaining believable shadows, focus, and edge detail.The new **Expand image** feature fills in content beyond an image’s original borders, making it easier to turn a square asset into a wide web header or mobile hero without painstaking manual recomposition.AI Insider characterizes the trio—object removal, object isolation, and AI-assisted expansion—as a unified suite designed to streamline common edits inside product and marketing workflows.

paragraphs.content: Figma’s release notes confirm that all three tools live in a consolidated contextual toolbar that also surfaces popular actions like Remove background, annotations, and text overlays for faster access.The company says background removal remains one of its most-used AI features, and its prominence in the new toolbar reflects how these image utilities are increasingly central to everyday design work.By colocating AI edits with core layout and prototyping tools, Figma is betting that designers will keep more of their workflow inside a single environment instead of treating the canvas as a handoff point to raster editors.The AI photo-editing capabilities also dovetail with Figma’s broader push into AI-assisted creation, including tools in Figma Make that generate responsive layouts and app flows from natural-language prompts.

sections.title: Reception, limitations, and what this means for Figma’s competitive position

paragraphs.content: Early reactions from the design community and tech press describe the launch as less about flashy AI and more about eliminating “everyday frustrations” that once forced teams into Photoshop or Canva for basic clean-up.TechCrunch emphasizes that Figma is “finally catching up” on object removal and image expansion, but argues the timing still matters as Adobe simultaneously pushes similar capabilities into ChatGPT.Independent reviewers on YouTube have praised the tools as “extremely efficient and useful” for typical UI, marketing, and thumbnail work, while acknowledging that complex edge cases can still produce “funny fails” and artifacts.AI Insider similarly concludes that while dedicated pixel editors retain an edge for high-stakes precision, Figma’s integrated suite meaningfully reduces friction for the vast majority of everyday edits.

primarySource.name: figma
primarySource.title: Introducing three new tools for precise image editing in Figma

paragraphs.content: Looking ahead, Figma plans to extend the new image-editing capabilities beyond Design and Draw to additional products across its platform in 2026, aligning with a broader strategy to keep creation, iteration, and asset prep in one place.The company’s AI roadmap, which already includes model partnerships and no-code tools for building photo-editing apps in Figma Make, suggests deeper integration between generative design and in-canvas editing over time.Analysts note that as Figma reduces reliance on external editors for “boring but essential tasks,” it strengthens its position as a primary hub for interface and marketing design teams.How far these tools evolve—and whether similar functionality surfaces in ecosystem integrations like ChatGPT—will influence how tightly Figma is woven into the next wave of AI-driven creative workflows.
